Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Bowl
Description: One of numerous examples of this type of hemispherical bowl. This particular vessel is crude, thick and made from a common, buff-coloured fine clay. The lip is irregular but nevertheless decorated with a red line.
